title: The Interpublic Group of Companies recommends clients pause advertising on Twitter
description:
The Interpublic Group of Companies (IPG), one of the largest advertising companies, issued a statement recommending its clients pause advertising on Twitter due to moderation concerns. The Global Alliance for Responsible Media, an initiative by the World Federation of Advertisers, has also stated it will be monitoring Twitter's content moderation policies.

* ["Elon Musk’s Twitter Faces Exodus of Advertisers and Executives"](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/11/01/technology/elon-musk-twitter-advertisers.html), *The New York Times*

title: Twitter's head of advertising, product, and core engineering resign
description:
Twitter's head of advertising Sarah Personette, head of engineering Nick Caldwell, and head of product Jay Sullivan have resigned.

* ["Twitter’s head of advertising, product, and core engineering have all left the company."](https://www.theverge.com/2022/11/1/23435042/twitters-head-of-advertising-product-and-core-engineering-have-all-left-the-company), *The Verge*

title: Twitter's planned paid verification system inspires scammers
description:
The confusion surrounding Twitter's paid verification system, set to be released on November 7, has resulted in scams taking advantage of the chaos. One such phishing campaign, as reported by [TechCrunch](https://techcrunch.com/2022/10/31/twitter-verification-phishing/), targets verified accounts. The scam, which used Google Sites, has since been taken down.

* ["Twitter’s verification chaos is now a cybersecurity problem"](https://techcrunch.com/2022/10/31/twitter-verification-phishing/), *TechCrunch*
